newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Sterling seen pushing through 2.8050 mark.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Sterling seen pushing through 2.8050 mark.

text.p: Sterling has pierced stiff resistance just above the 2.80-mark area and is setting itself up for further gains, said analysts.
"We have seen a re-test of the previous 2.7930-mark area and now sterling has the potential to head towards the 2.8050-mark level," said Nico Bakker, technical analyst at ABN AMRO.
Bakker said sterling was no longer toppy against the mark after its push to fresh 4-1/2 year peaks above 2.82 marks on Tuesday.
At 0728 GMT sterling/mark was trading at 2.8015/22 marks against 2.8058/68 in late Europe on Wednesday.
Against the dollar, sterling's push through $1.6250 in early dealings is likely to fuel a ride towards the $1.63-level, said analysts.
At 0815 GMT sterlingwas at $1.6247/57 and off session highs of $1.6262 versus $1.6235/45 in late Europe on Wednesday.
"We have seen a break-out at the $1.6250 level and we now could be heading towards the $1.63 level," said ABN's Bakker.

Alan Dunne, technical analyst at Bank of America, said a stumble through support at $1.6175, the April lows, could open the way for $1.6090. A push higher and above $1.63, he added, would be capped at $1.6320.
